intro: Cryptantha jonesiana, commonly known as Jones' cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Cryptantha jonesiana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
